Question_1.Context: The study aimed to explore the effects of A. triloba fruit extract on murine preadipocytes (3T3-L1) by examining lipid droplet formation and intracellular pro-adipogenic protein levels. What was the main finding regarding the treatment with A. triloba 70% ethanolic fruit extract?
Question_1.Question: What was the main finding regarding the treatment with A. triloba 70% ethanolic fruit extract?
Question_1.B: It had no effect on lipid droplet formation.
Question_1.C: It effectively suppressed lipid droplet formation.
Question_1.D: It increased intracellular pro-adipogenic protein levels.
Question_1.Source: The results revealed that treatment with A. triloba 70% ethanolic fruit extract effectively suppressed lipid droplet formation.

Question_2.Context: What is the significance of PPARγ and C/EBPα in adipogenesis according to the study?
Question_2.Question: What is the significance of PPARγ and C/EBPα in adipogenesis according to the study?
Question_2.C: They have no effect on adipogenesis.
Question_2.Source: PPARγ and C/EBPα are critical transcription factors that regulate early adipocyte differentiation. Their expression influences the expression of adipogenic genes, leading to increased fatty acid synthesis and triglyceride production in adipose tissue.

Question_3.Context: What was the effect of A. triloba ethanolic fruit extract on the viability of 3T3-L1 cells?
Question_3.Question: What was the effect of A. triloba ethanolic fruit extract on the viability of 3T3-L1 cells?
Question_3.B: It had no effect on cell viability.
Question_3.D: It varied depending on the concentration.
Question_3.Source: Compared with the control group, A. triloba fruit 70% ethanolic extracts exhibited no toxicity towards preadipocytes.

Question_4.Context: What was the main effect of A. triloba ethanolic fruit extract on lipid accumulation in 3T3-L1 cells?
Question_4.Question: What was the main effect of A. triloba ethanolic fruit extract on lipid accumulation in 3T3-L1 cells?
Question_4.B: It had no effect on lipid accumulation.
Question_4.D: It varied depending on the concentration.
Question_4.Source: AT significantly inhibited lipid accumulation in a dose-dependent manner.

Question_5.Context: What was the effect of A. triloba ethanolic fruit extract on the expression of key adipogenesis markers in 3T3-L1 cells?
Question_5.Question: What was the effect of A. triloba ethanolic fruit extract on the expression of key adipogenesis markers in 3T3-L1 cells?
Question_5.B: It had no effect on their expression.
Question_5.D: It varied depending on the concentration.
Question_5.Source: Treatment with AT effectively suppressed the expression of key adipogenesis markers, including PPARγ, SREBP1, and C/EBPα.

Question_6.Context: What was the main finding regarding the extraction yield of Asimina triloba fruits using 70% ethanol?
Question_6.Question: What was the main finding regarding the extraction yield of Asimina triloba fruits using 70% ethanol?
Question_6.C: It had no effect on yield.
Question_6.D: It varied depending on the concentration of ethanol.
Question_6.Source: The optimal ethanol concentration for A. triloba fruit extraction was 70%, which demonstrated both the highest extraction yield and non-cytotoxic properties.

Question_7.Context: What was the effect of A. triloba ethanolic fruit extract on the expression of AMPK in 3T3-L1 cells?
Question_7.Question: What was the effect of A. triloba ethanolic fruit extract on the expression of AMPK in 3T3-L1 cells?
Question_7.B: It had no effect on AMPK expression.
Question_7.D: It varied depending on the concentration.
Question_7.Source: Additionally, the transcription levels and phosphoprotein activity of AMPK was significantly increased in AT-treated cells compared with those in the control.

Question_8.Context: What was the main limitation mentioned in the study regarding the research on A. triloba fruit?
Question_8.Question: What was the main limitation mentioned in the study regarding the research on A. triloba fruit?
Question_8.Source: The study’s limitations include that there may be other compounds that have not been studied in the pulp and peel of A. triloba fruit used in the experiment.

Question_9.Context: What was the conclusion drawn regarding the potential of Asimina triloba fruit as a natural source for anti-obesity functional agents?
Question_9.Question: What was the conclusion drawn regarding the potential of Asimina triloba fruit as a natural source for anti-obesity functional agents?
Question_9.A: It has no potential for anti-obesity effects.
Question_9.B: It may serve as a natural source for anti-obesity functional agents.
Question_9.D: It has no effect on lipid synthesis.
Question_9.Source: These results suggest the potential of Asimina triloba fruit as a valuable natural source for the development of anti-obesity functional agents.

Question_10.Context: What was the main focus of the study regarding the effects of A. triloba fruit extract on murine preadipocytes?
Question_10.Question: What was the main focus of the study regarding the effects of A. triloba fruit extract on murine preadipocytes?
Question_10.C: To increase intracellular pro-adipogenic protein levels.
Question_10.Source: These findings suggest that A. triloba fruit has the potential to prevent obesity by inhibiting fat synthesis.
